channel.title: How do I declare this?

item.title: How do I declare this?
item.dc:creator: @Avalon Avalon
item.description:
@Avalon wrote:

For one, it looks like you have a few extra closing brackets. Secondly, make sure the capitalization in your call to the “hasntLoggedin” method is correct.

Posting your error(s) might be a good idea too.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I declare this?
item.dc:creator: @Avalon Avalon
item.description:
@Avalon wrote:

You can put it anywhere in the Client class except for other method bodies.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I declare this?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

Anywhere as long as it isn’t interfering with another method.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I declare this?
item.dc:creator: @Torax1 Torax™
item.description:
@Torax1 wrote:

This is the second part of the code for perfect pickup. Where do I put it?

public int apickupid = -1;
public int apickupx = -1;
public int apickupy = -1;
public void scanPickup()
{
if (absX == apickupx && absY == apickupy)
{
if (ItemHandler.itemExists(apickupid, absX, absY))
{
int itemAmount = ItemHandler.itemAmount(apickupid, apickupx, apickupy);
if (addItem(apickupid, itemAmount))
{
ItemHandler.removeItem(apickupid, apickupx, apickupy, itemAmount);
}
}
else if (hasntLoggedin){
}
resetPickup(); //resets the pickup whether it was successful or not ;p - SKatty
}
}
public void resetPickup(){
apickupid = -1;
apickupx = -1;
apickupy = -1;
}

Read full topic
